thread.title: Protester pelts Blatter with money | Soccer
thread.title_full: Protester pelts Blatter with money | Soccer | BDlive

author: Staff Writer
title: Protester pelts Blatter with money | Soccer
text:
Money rains on FIFA boss Sepp Blatter in this screengrab from a video on YouTube. Related articles Fifa’s Blatter snubs call to testify Meet the investigative journalist who hunted down Fifa Fifa head Blatter shifts blame to confederations in interview THE once-omnipotent FIFA boss Sepp Blatter was on Monday confronted by a protester throwing money at him as he prepared to host a press conference in Zurich‚ Switzerland‚ to announce how the world soccer federation intends to elect a new president.
British media are identifying the prankster as Simon Brodkin‚ an English comedian. The paper notes are believed to be fake dollars.
FIFA and Blatter‚ the outgoing president‚ are mired in a major bribery scandal that earlier this year saw US prosecutors lay charges against 14 soccer officials.
Money rains on Sepp Blatter
Allegations of corruption have marred the awarding of the 2010 World Cup in South Africa and speculation is rife about the 2018 and 2022 World Cups‚ due to be held in Russia and Qatar.
Watch the press conference here
RDM News Wire
